pull.title: test: use `sendall` when emptying wallet
pull.body: In some tests they have used `sendtoaddress` in order to empty a wallet. With the addition of `sendall`, it makes sense to use it for that.

events.body:
Does it make sense to also change the other occurrences of this usage scenario? 
See `git grep 'sendtoaddress.*getbalance'`

> Does it make sense to also change the other occurrences of this usage scenario?

Make sense, let me check other cases and if so, I will update them and change the PR title/desc.

rename.to: test: use sendall when emptying wallet

rename.from: test: use sendall when emptying wallet

events.body:
Thanks for the suggestion, @kouloumos.

Force-pushed replacing `sendtoaddress` to `sendall` for all cases where they want to empty a wallet.

ACK 923d24583d826f4c6ecad30b185e0e043ea11dfc, this change makes sense as that's one of the intended uses with the introduction of this RPC. 

Similar change in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/25159.

events.message:
test: simplify splitment with `sendall` in wallet_basic

recipients receive equal share of the unspecified amount

events.body:
utACK 28ea4c7039710541e70ec01abefc3eb8268e06f5
I think one of the reasons behind `sendall` was so that it could be used to simplify functional tests.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -587,7 +587,7 @@ def run_test(self):
 
         # Get all non-zero utxos together
         chain_addrs = [self.nodes[0].getnewaddress(), self.nodes[0].getnewaddress()]
-        singletxid = self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(chain_addrs[0], self.nodes[0].getbalance(), "", "", True)
+        singletxid = self.nodes[0].sendall(recipients=[chain_addrs[0]])['txid']
comments.body:
This might be out of scope, although it still uses the `sendall` to simplify the logic and makes L591-596 redundant:

```suggestion
        # Split all non-zero utxos into two chains
        self.nodes[0].sendall(recipients=chain_addrs)['txid']
```
_Note: `recipients` receive equal share of the unspecified amount_

-        singletxid = self.nodes[0].sendtoaddress(chain_addrs[0], self.nodes[0].getbalance(), "", "", True)

comments.body: Nice catch! Added this on a new commit.

comments.body: In 923d24583d826f4c6ecad30b185e0e043ea11dfc I think that this change can be removed as it is modified in the next commit anyways?
